articles.author: Maria Aspan
articles.title: Companies don't want to fight with Trump. That may be reshaping the economy - NPR
articles.description: Critics warn that Trump's demands for business leaders to step down, and for the government to take a cut of sales, threaten American-style capitalism.
articles.content:
Corporate America doesn't want to fight with President Trump in public. But as a result, it's ceding him an unprecedented amount of control over the shape and future of U.S. business.
In the past we… [+8584 chars]

articles.description: The American had faked his death and fled to Scotland in a bid to escape justice.
articles.content:
Jane MacSorley and Megan Bonar

articles.author: Ayana Archie
articles.title: Percentage of Americans who say they drink alcohol hits record low, Gallup says - NPR
articles.description: Gallup, which started tracking Americans' alcohol habits more than 80 years ago, says the drop in drinking rates coincides with Americans' growing concerns that even moderate drinking is unhealthy.
articles.content: The percentage of Americans who say they drink has fallen to a record low, according to a new Gallup poll. The dip coincides with a growing concern among those surveyed that drinking even in moderati… [+4356 chars]
